channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Minnesotans remain skeptical as tensions as state-federal tensions appear to ease
item.description: A preliminary government review contradicts the White House's initial narrative of the shooting of 37-year-old Alex Pretti in Minneapolis. The review comes as officials work to ease tensions.
item.content:encoded: A preliminary government review contradicts the White House's initial narrative of the shooting of 37-year-old Alex Pretti in Minneapolis. The review comes as officials work to ease tensions.
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: Former Homeland secretary on Kristi Noem's responsibility in deadly shootings
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin talks to former Homeland Secretary Jeh Johnson about DHS Secretary Kristi Noem's culpability in the deadly shootings by federal agents.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Michel Martin talks to former Homeland Secretary Jeh Johnson about DHS Secretary Kristi Noem's culpability in the deadly shootings by federal agents.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: The Trump administration has secretly rewritten nuclear safety rules
item.description: The rewrite was done to speed up the construction of a new generation of nuclear reactors. Critics warn it could compromise safety and public trust.
item.content:encoded: The rewrite was done to speed up the construction of a new generation of nuclear reactors. Critics warn it could compromise safety and public trust.
item.dc:creator: Geoff Brumfiel

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump says the economy is "booming" in Iowa message, the NTSB releases finding in DCA midair crash, Trump administration quietly rewrites nuclear safety directives.
item.content:encoded: Trump says the economy is "booming" in Iowa message, the NTSB releases finding in DCA midair crash, Trump administration quietly rewrites nuclear safety directives.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Author Kurt Vonnegut's estate files lawsuit to challenge Utah book ban law
item.description: The author Kurt Vonnegut's estate has sued to challenge a Utah law that allows school districts to ban books from their libraries. Supporters of the law say it keeps pornography out of schools.
item.content:encoded: The author Kurt Vonnegut's estate has sued to challenge a Utah law that allows school districts to ban books from their libraries. Supporters of the law say it keeps pornography out of schools.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Marco Rubio to be questioned about America's future in Venezuela at hearing
item.description: The capture of Nicolás Maduro has fueled questions about the future of U.S. policy in Venezuela. For Secretary of State Marco Rubio, it was part of a years-long push for change in South America.
item.content:encoded: The capture of Nicolás Maduro has fueled questions about the future of U.S. policy in Venezuela. For Secretary of State Marco Rubio, it was part of a years-long push for change in South America.
item.dc:creator: Claudia Grisales

item.title: After violence in Minneapolis, some influencers break from typical content
item.description: Lifestyle influencers or those cute animal accounts on social media rarely feature commentary about news and politics. The violence in Minneapolis has been an exception.
item.content:encoded: Lifestyle influencers or those cute animal accounts on social media rarely feature commentary about news and politics. The violence in Minneapolis has been an exception.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: Virginia's new governor lays out plan to bring down the cost of living
item.description: Virginia Gov. Abigail Spanberger ran her campaign on affordability. Now that she's in office, she'll be under a political microscope to see if she can bring down the cost of living.
item.content:encoded: Virginia Gov. Abigail Spanberger ran her campaign on affordability. Now that she's in office, she'll be under a political microscope to see if she can bring down the cost of living.
item.dc:creator: Jahd Khalil

item.title: Trump says the U.S. economy is 'booming,' but data contradicts his message
item.description: President Trump went to Iowa Tuesday, looking to change the subject to his economic agenda as his administration faces growing backlash over his immigration crackdown in Minnesota.
item.content:encoded: President Trump went to Iowa Tuesday, looking to change the subject to his economic agenda as his administration faces growing backlash over his immigration crackdown in Minnesota.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Trump tried to turn attention back to the economy in Iowa. Did it work?
item.description: Did President Trump manage to turn conversation back to affordability with his address in Iowa Tuesday? NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Republican strategist Alex Conant.
item.content:encoded: Did President Trump manage to turn conversation back to affordability with his address in Iowa Tuesday? NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Republican strategist Alex Conant.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin
